newsitem.title: FRANCE: Eridania sees lower '96 operating profit.
newsitem.headline: Eridania sees lower '96 operating profit.

text.p: Eridania Beghin Say said on Thursday it expected a drop in its 1996 operating results of about six percent compared to 1995.
It said in a statement that it expected its net result to rise in 1996 because of stable financial costs and a reduction in net exceptional charges.

"It appears already that the operating profit of the group will be about 3.75 billion francs, down about six percent compared to that of 1995 and that despite the contribution of CFS business," the company said.

It said the second half of the year was better than the first, but said that certain of its businesses suffered the effect of bad agricultural campaigns, often accompanied by a rise in the prices of raw materials.

"Nevertheless, the net consolidated result should post a new increase compared to that of 1995, because of the stability of financial costs and taxes as well as the reduction of net exceptional charges," the statement said.
It said its net debt to shareholder funds ratio would be close to 0.72 in 1996 compared to 0.67 at the end of 1995.
